author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Pennsylvania's top elections officer refused to provide the Trump administration with sensitive personal information of the state's voters, arguing that it would violate state law and that the request was an attempt to expand the federal government's role in the electoral process.
title: Pennsylvania rejects DOJ request for voter rolls with personal data

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Friday announced that he has tapped top aide Sergio Gor to serve as ambassador to India and special envoy for South and Central Asia, saying he wanted someone he can “fully trust” in the role. “I am pleased to announce that I am promoting Sergio Gor to be our next United States…
title: Trump taps Sergio Gor as India ambassador

author: Joseph Choi
description: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) moved Friday to derecognize labor union representation for staffers at multiple subagencies and offices, claiming the action is “removing unnecessary obstacles to mission-critical work.” The HHS is derecognizing representation within several offices represented by the National Treasury Employees Union; American Federation of Government Employees (AFGE); National Alliance…
title: HHS derecognizing unions representing staffers at CDC, FDA, NIH and more

author: Alex Gangitano
description: The Justice Department on Friday released transcripts and audio files from its interview with Ghislaine Maxwell and turned over to House lawmakers thousands of pages of documents related to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The disclosures came as Justice Department officials sought to satisfy lawmakers in both parties who had pushed for more transparency around the…
title: DOJ releases interview with Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell: 5 takeaways

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: President Trump wrote that he is “very angry” at Ukraine after it bombed the Druzhba pipeline that supplies Hungary with oil.  Ukraine bombed the Unecha oil pumping station in Russia, according to Ukraine’s Unmanned Systems Forces commander Robert Brovdi, also known as Madyar. Oil deliveries from the Druzhba pipeline could be suspended for five days. An initial strike…
title: Trump told Orban he’s ‘very angry’ at Ukraine over pipeline attack

author: Sylvan Lane
description: President Trump said Friday he will impose tariffs on imported furniture “within the next 50 days.” In a post on social media, Trump said his administration will begin an investigation into furniture imports, which would lay the groundwork for imposing tariffs on those goods. He said the tax rate on imported furniture has not yet…
title: Trump says US will impose tariffs on all foreign furniture

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: U.S. District Judge Matthew Brann, a Republican appointed by Obama, ruled that Trump pick Alina Habba lacks the authority to serve as the acting U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, prompting criticism from Habba and Attorney General Pam Bondi.
title: Alina Habba judge is Republican, Federalist Society member

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: The Campus Guardian Angel is looking to deploy drones to combat school shootings, running test trials in Florida.   Campus Guardian Angel CEO Justin Marston told The Hill the system puts drones in boxes at different points around a school, triggered by an emergency silent alarm and moving within 5 seconds.   The drones are…
title: Company looks to deploy drones to combat school shootings

author: Sylvan Lane
description: The stock market closed at record highs Friday after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell sparked confidence in a September rate cut among Wall Street traders. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose more than 840 points Friday, gaining 1.9 percent to close at a record high of 45,631.74. The Nasdaq composite also posted a gain of…
title: Dow hits record high as stocks rally on Powell speech, rate cut hopes

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: David Axelrod, the Obama-era White House chief strategist, weighed in on the FBI raid of John Bolton’s house Friday, arguing the move will “send a message” to critics of the Trump administration. “I think this is not just an attempt to, or could be, an attempt to silence John Bolton, but also to send a message to…
title: Axelrod: FBI raid is ‘attempt to silence’ John Bolton

author: Brett Samuels
description: Ghislaine Maxwell, a former close associate of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, told the Justice Department she “never witnessed” President Trump in an “inappropriate setting,” according to a transcript released Friday. “I think they were friendly like people are in social settings,” Maxwell told Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche of Trump’s relationship with Epstein. “I…
title: Maxwell told DOJ she ‘never witnessed’ Trump in ‘inappropriate setting’

author: Filip Timotija
description: The second-highest-ranking official at the Treasury Department, Michael Faulkender, is departing President Trump’s administration after being confirmed by the Senate about five months ago.  “I would like to thank Deputy Secretary Faulkender for his dedication and service. Since January, he has played a critical role in overseeing the U.S. Department of the Treasury’s operations and…
title: No. 2 Treasury official departing after 5 months in role

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was mistakenly deported but returned to the U.S., has been ordered released from a Tennessee jail by a magistrate judge.   U.S. Magistrate Judge Barbara Holmes signed the order for Abrego Garcia’s release Friday. His lawyer, Sean Hecker, told several outlets that Abrego Garcia is now en route to his family after being “unlawfully arrested…
title: Abrego Garcia released from prison, headed to family

author: Caroline Vakil
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) teased campaign merchandise akin to President Trump’s MAGA items in a post Friday, a decision that coincides with his mimicking of the president on social media. “NEW MERCH COMING SOON! YOU’RE WELCOME, PATRIOTS!” Newsom wrote in a post on the social platform X, with several American flag emojis.  The post featured…
title: Newsom teases MAGA-like campaign merchandise

author: Brett Samuels
description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) on Friday released a transcript and audio files of Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche’s interview with Ghislaine Maxwell, a former associate of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Blanche sat down with Maxwell over the course of two days. The transcript of the first day’s interview on July 24 totals 263…
title: DOJ releases Todd Blanche’s interview with Ghislaine Maxwell

author: Zach Kaplan
description: Walmart offered more than 7,400 discounts in its second quarter, including 30% more grocery discounts compared to last year.
title: Walmart hikes discounts for shoppers amid tariff uncertainty

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) on Friday responded to a state judge’s ruling ordering his administration to dismantle operations at Alligator Alcatraz, an immigration detention center in the Everglades. “We knew this would likely happen and we will respond accordingly,” the Sunshine State leader said during a press conference.  DeSantis has been overwhelmingly supportive of…
title: DeSantis responds to ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ ruling, touts ‘Deportation Depot’

author: Julia Shapero
description: President Trump said Friday that Intel has agreed to give the U.S. government a 10 percent stake in the company.  “They’ve agreed to do it, and I think it’s a great deal for them,” Trump told reporters.  The administration has been weighing taking a stake in the struggling American chipmaker, pulling from previously allocated funding,…
title: Trump says Intel has agreed to give US 10 percent stake

author: Julia Shapero
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said Friday that the company is “in dialogue” with the U.S. government about selling next-generation artificial intelligence (AI) chips to China.  “Offering a new product to China for the AI data centers, the follow on to H20, that’s not our decision to make,” Huang told reporters in Taiwan on Friday. “It’s…
title: Nvidia in ‘dialogue’ with US government on next-gen chip sales to China

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Air pollutants from U.S. oil and gas operations are causing 91,000 premature deaths and hundreds of thousands of health issues each year — with racial and ethnic minority populations bearing the biggest burden, a new study has found.  The outdoor contaminants, which include fine particulate matter (PM 2.5), nitrogen dioxide (NO2) and ozone, take the…
title: US oil and gas air pollution is causing unequal health impacts: Study

author: Jianli Yang, opinion contributor
description: The US pharmaceutical supply chain is heavily reliant on China for key ingredients, creating vulnerabilities in drug safety and quality control, and requiring a comprehensive strategy to mitigate these risks.
title: Cheap drugs, high stakes: America’s risky bet on China

author: Jonathan Zimmerman, opinion contributor
description: President Trump's executive order to end "indoctrination" in American schools has sparked controversy, as state superintendent Ryan Walters has engaged Prager University to create an assessment test for new teachers, which has been accused of promoting its own brand of indoctrination.
title: Teaching ‘just the facts’ is not an answer to ‘indoctrination’

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: An updated legal challenge from Planned Parenthood in South Carolina seeks to preserve Medicaid for its health centers after a recent Supreme Court decision allowed the state to restrict federal funding.  The filing challenges the constitutionality of Gov. Henry McMaster’s (R) order that blocks Medicaid funds from clinics that provide abortions.  The complaint asked a federal…
title: Planned Parenthood sues South Carolina over Medicaid ban

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Friday he planned to ask Congress for $2 billion to make improvements around Washington, D.C., the latest instance of the president intervening in the day-to-day operations of the nation’s capital. “We’re going to be raising about $2 billion from Congress, and Congress is happy to do it, and we’re going to wisely…
title: Trump says he’ll ask Congress for $2B for DC improvements

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Friday said Russian President Vladimir Putin may attend the 2026 FIFA World Cup being co-hosted by the U.S., Canada and Mexico, showing off a photograph in the Oval Office of the two leaders together. Trump hosted FIFA President Gianni Infantino to announce the World Cup draw will be held at the Kennedy…
title: Trump says Putin may attend North America’s World Cup

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Federal agents searched the home of former national security adviser John Bolton on Friday, targeting one of President Trump’s most outspoken critics. The FBI confirmed there was “court-authorized law enforcement activity” going on in the area of Bolton’s Maryland home. The search was reportedly related to Bolton’s handling of classified information. The move marked an…
title: Five things to know about FBI search of John Bolton’s home, office

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Friday the federal government would turn its attention to Chicago next to try and crack down on crime after surging law enforcement and deploying the National Guard in Washington, D.C. “After we do this, we’ll go to another location, and we’ll make it safe also,” Trump told reporters in the Oval Office.…
title: Trump says federal crime crackdown will target Chicago next

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump announced Friday that the 2026 FIFA World Cup draw will take place at the Kennedy Center, following his administration’s takeover of the Washington, D.C., cultural center. The draw will be held Dec. 5, Trump said in the Oval Office, where he was flanked by FIFA President Gianni Infantino, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem,…
title: Trump: 2026 World Cup draw will be held at Kennedy Center

author: Rep. Pat Fallon (R-Texas), opinion contributor
description: Offshore wind turbines are causing radar interference that is disrupting air traffic and posing a national security threat, while the push for renewable energy has led to safety concerns being ignored and the U.S. becoming increasingly economically beholden to China.
title: Feel good energy policies continue to bear fruit — for China

author: Julia Shapero
description: President Trump suggested Friday that he may once again extend the deadline for TikTok’s parent company to divest from the popular video-sharing app or face a U.S. ban.  For months, Trump has sought to strike a deal to keep TikTok available in the U.S., pushing back the deadline three separate times. The latest extension is…
title: Trump says he may extend TikTok ban deadline again

author: Joseph Chamie, opinion contributor
description: In Lewis Carroll’s classic work, the Queen of Hearts famously demanded, “Off with their heads!”  Increasingly government leaders worldwide are following suit by removing the heads of their country’s statistical offices who report unwelcome, inconvenient data on levels and trends truthfully.   The latest example is President Trump’s recent firing of the commissioner of the Bureau of Labor Statistics.…
title: A brief history of firing statisticians for telling the truth

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A Spanish-language reporter who was detained earlier this year has filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration, alleging he’s being held in custody in violation of the Constitution. Mario Guevara, 47, was arrested by police near Atlanta on June 14 while filming a “No Kings” protest — which sprung up in opposition to President Trump’s…
title: Spanish-language reporter detained by Trump administration sues for release

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Another day, another reality check for the Democratic Party: Their candidates have alienated Gen Z, particularly white young men (although young men of color aren’t huge fans of Democrats either).  The New York Times dug into some numbers this week, and found the Democratic recruitment drive is failing all over the country. Voter registration used…
title: Trump GOP dominating with Gen Z; white zoomers hate Dems

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump on Friday afternoon is expected to make an announcement from the White House. The announcement comes after former national security adviser John Bolton’s home near the nation’s capital was raided by FBI agents. During his visit to The People’s House museum in Washington on Friday morning, the president said he “knew nothing about…
title: Watch live: Trump to make announcement from Oval Office

author: Tim Renaud
description: Police said the woman's backpack had more than 39 grams of methamphetamine, more than 37 grams of fentanyl, seven grams of cocaine, cocaine base, 16 Xanax bars, and a large amount of marijuana.
title: Woman found with ‘large quantity’ of drugs, firearms in South Carolina

author: Andrew Dorn
description: The DOJ had accused Greystar of using a rent-setting algorithm and colluding with competitors to boost profits.
title: Nation’s largest landlord settles price-fixing claims with DOJ

author: Rob Taub
description: The survey found that 53% of men and 54% of women didn't spend a dime on dates.
title: Romantic recession? Half of Gen Z adults spend $0 on dating

author: Noah Yosif, opinion contributor
description: To keep pace with the realities of today’s labor market, the federal government must modernize its measurement of work itself.
title: The government may be massively undercounting gig workers

author: Filip Timotija
description: The European Union’s (EU) top diplomat Kaja Kallas on Friday said Russian President Vladimir Putin is “laughing” at President Trump’s efforts to broker a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine.  Kallas, the EU’s foreign policy chief, said the president’s push to end the conflict in Eastern Europe is “welcome,” but that the Russian leader is…
title: EU’s top diplomat: Putin ‘laughing’ at Trump’s Russia-Ukraine peace efforts

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Third Way, a center-left think tank, has advised Democrats to avoid using words such as "birthing person," "cisgender," "the unhoused" and "Latinx" in order to better connect with voters and counter President Trump's agenda.
title: Third Way circulates ‘blacklist’ of terms Democrats shouldn’t use

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Cracker Barrel’s stock plummeted $94 million on Thursday after the country staple restaurant pushed out an unexpected rebrand of their logo.  The 55-year-old company shed its share value by 7.2 percent following the decision to remove the old man and carefully sketched barrel on its logo, as well as the whipping “K” flourish over the…
title: Cracker Barrel loses almost $100M in value after divisive logo ‘refresh’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The White House on Thursday unveiled a list of 20 Smithsonian exhibits the Trump administration alleges are being used to frame historical events through “ideological” narratives instead of factual evidence. Items categorized as unacceptable include an exhibit at the National Museum of the American Latino that portrays the U.S. as stolen land and characterizes U.S.…
title: White House lists 20 objectionable Smithsonian exhibits, artworks

author: Roger House, opinion contributor
description: The deployments have spurred a debate over the legality of the administration’s use of federal police and the National Guard generally — and the role of Black cops and troops in carrying them out in particular.
title: How Black police and soldiers have resisted federal takeovers of their communities

author: Jared Gans
description: The Minnesota Democratic-Farmer-Labor (DFL) Party has overturned Minneapolis party’s endorsement of state Sen. Omar Fateh (D), the democratic socialist challenging Mayor Jacob Frey (D), following allegations of a flawed process at the party’s convention last month. State DFL Party Chair Richard Carlbom said in a statement Thursday that the party’s committee overseeing bylaws and rules…
title: Democrats vacate endorsement of Democratic Socialist mayoral candidate in Minneapolis

author: Filip Timotija
description: Famine was declared on Friday in parts of the Gaza Strip, with over half a million Palestinians facing “starvation, destruction and death,” according to a warning released by the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC). “Just when it seems there are no words left to describe the living hell in Gaza, a new one has…
title: Famine declared in Gaza; 500,000 face ‘starvation, destitution and death’

author: Sylvan Lane
description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said Friday the central bank faces “significant uncertainty” as it attempts to navigate the impact of President Trump’s policies, suggesting the bank could cut rates as the job market weakens. In remarks at the Fed’s annual summit in Jackson Hole, Wyo., Powell said the Fed needs to determine whether the…
title: Powell suggests Fed could cut rates soon as Trump policies shake economy

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov has stated that President Putin is only willing to meet with Ukrainian President Zelensky if an agenda for the summit is prepared, while President Trump has suggested several points for discussion, but Zelensky has rejected them.
title: Russia says Putin-Zelensky meeting agenda ‘not ready at all’

author: Shohret Hoshur, opinion contributor
description: Five months ago, I left Radio Free Asia on furlough. Last week, my resignation became official. Like most of my colleagues, I made the difficult choice to leave when it became clear the Trump administration would not reverse its decision to defund and close the agency. For the Uyghur people, this closure is more than…
title: Radio Free Asia’s Uyghur service is gone — but the fight lives on

author: The Hill Staff
description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell spoke on the economy Friday morning in Wyoming as President Trump continues to prod the nation’s central bank for interest rate cuts. Powell, after announcing in July that the Fed would keep rates steady for the fifth straight month, justified the decision by pointing to a “strong” jobs report and…
title: Watch: Powell speaks on economy at Jackson Hole as Trump boosts pressure on Fed

author: Benn Steil, opinion contributor
description: I have previously attributed the troubling rise of national political polarization to the erosion of the middle class — a deep concern of thinkers as far removed in time and space as Aristotle and James Madison.  But what about the link between the rise of polarization and the concentration of power in the person of the president? James…
title: MAGA is destroying Madisonian democracy

author: Filip Timotija
description: President Trump sent a warning to D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) early Friday, threatening to extend the federal takeover of local police in the nation’s capital citing “inaccurate” crime reporting data. “Washington, D.C. is SAFE AGAIN! The crowds are coming back, the spirit is high, and our D.C. National Guard and Police are doing a…
title: Trump threatens Bowser with expansion of DC takeover over crime stats

author: Kirstie McDermott | THIS COLUMN WAS CREATED BY JOBBIO
description: Already on edge thanks to repeated rounds of layoffs, the latest revisions from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) haven’t been great news for U.S. workers. The updated figures showed that just 73,000 new jobs were added in July, which fell well below expectations. Layoffs are also rising at twice the rate seen last year.…
title: American workers are experiencing a skills masking crisis

author: Matt K. Lewis, opinion contributor
description: Trump promised to “bring prices down on Day One.” How’s that going for him?
title: Will rising food prices hurt Trump?

author: Jesse Byrnes
description: FBI Director Kash Patel posted a cryptic message Friday morning amid reports that federal agents were conducting a raid at the home of John Bolton, President Trump’s former national security adviser. “NO ONE is above the law…@FBI agents on mission,” Patel wrote on social platform X shortly after 7 a.m., without mentioning anyone by name.…
title: Kash Patel posts cryptic message amid Bolton raid

description: The FBI reportedly raided the home of former national security adviser John Bolton, who has been a vocal critic of Trump and the White House, early Friday. The search, two sources told The Hill’s sister network NewsNation, is related to classified documents. GOP state lawmakers in Texas are also slated to approve new voting maps…
title: Live updates: FBI raids John Bolton home; redistricting war reaches fever pitch

author: Dov S. Zakheim, opinion contributor
description: The Geneva Conventions label the kidnapping of children as both a war crime and a crime against humanity.
title: Russia must stop kidnapping Ukrainian children and return the ones it’s holding

author: Julianna Russ
description: The Community Foundation of the Texas Hill Country announced a pledge of $40 million in donations that will go directly toward housing assistance for people impacted by the July 4 floods.
title: $40M in donations pledged for housing assistance after devastating Texas floods

author: Taylor Delandro
description: Hulk Hogan died at the age of 71 as a result of a heart attack caused by a form of leukemia.
title: Brooke Hogan says 911 calls, video key to Hulk Hogan’s death

author: Filip Timotija
description: Alina Habba, the acting U.S. Attorney for New Jersey, knocked Sen. Chuck Grassley (R-Iowa) on Thursday, after a federal judge ruled she lacks the authority to serve as the Garden State’s top federal prosecutor.  “Number one, I was the nominee to become the U.S. attorney. And [Democratic New Jersey Sens.] Cory Booker and Andy Kim,…
title: Habba knocks Grassley after judge rules she lacks legal authority

author: Liz Peek, opinion contributor
description: Young Democrats are excited about socialism. They are rallying behind mayoral candidates like Zohran Mamdani in New York and Omar Fateh in Minneapolis, as though these democratic socialist politicians have something new to sell. They do not.
title: Heads up, Gen Z: Socialism isn’t new, it isn’t cool and it doesn’t work

author: Filip Timotija
description: Federal agents raided the Washington-area home of President Trump’s former national security adviser John Bolton on Friday morning. FBI Director Kash Patel wrote “NO ONE is above the law… @FBI agents on mission” in a post on X at 7 a.m., shortly before the New York Post broke the news of the raid.  An FBI…
title: FBI raids John Bolton’s home

author: Gretchen Carlson and Julie Roginsky, opinion contributors
description: No matter how much President Trump is working to remove any mention of Jeffrey Epstein from the front pages, time is working against him.  When Congress returns in a few short weeks, after some members spent the August recess having to answer angry questions from constituents about why the administration refuses to release the oft-promised…
title: Trump is protecting everyone but Epstein’s survivors

description: Even before the overturning of Roe v. Wade, the pro-life movement was already taking heat for attempting to revive mail-order abortion rules within the Comstock Act — provisions that, if enforced, would immediately prohibit the mailing or shipping of abortion drugs on a national scale. Modern legal debate over its enforcement has left these rules…
title: Enforce the Comstock Act’s mail-order abortion rules

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Wildfires may be responsible for raising local deaths by about 67 percent in a given month, a new study has found. Scientists linked 82 “excess deaths” to the devastating blazes that struck Maui, Hawaii, in August 2023 — or two-thirds more fatalities than they would have otherwise expected for that month, per the study, published…
title: Wildfires could be raising local death rates by two-thirds: Study

author: Sophia Vento
description: A National Guardsman was ticketed on Wednesday after running a red light and injuring a person in a crash with a civilian vehicle in Washington, D.C. The incident, which occurred at 8th Street SE and North Carolina Ave near Eastern Market early Wednesday morning, involved a D.C. National Guard transport vehicle, according to the Joint…
title: National Guardsman ticketed for running red light in DC crash
